Package com.lambdaschool.webemployee.controllers

Class EmployeeController

java.lang.Object
com.lambdaschool.webemployee.controllers.EmployeeController
@RestController
public class EmployeeController
extends java.lang.Object
The entry point for clients to access employee data.

    org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> estimateRaise​(double raise)

  • Constructor Details

      public EmployeeController()

  • Method Details

    • listAllEmployees

      @GetMapping(value="/employees/all", produces="application/json") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> listAllEmployees()
      Returns a list of all employees
      Example: http://localhost:2019/employees.all
      Returns:
      JSON list of all employees order alphabetically by last name with a status of OK.

    • listAllByFirstName

      @GetMapping(value="/employees/name/{letter}", produces="application/json") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> listAllByFirstName​(@PathVariable char letter)
      Returns a list of employees whose first name starts with the given letter
      Example: http://localhost:2019/employees/name/s
      Parameters:
      letter - The first letter of the first name of the employees you seek. Case Sensitive.
      Returns:
      JSON list of the employees you seek with a status of OK

    • totalSalary

      @GetMapping(value="/employees/total", produces="application/json") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> totalSalary()
      Prints to the console the total of all employees' salaries.
      Example: http://localhost:2019/employees/total
      Returns:
      Status of OK

    • estimateRaise

      @GetMapping(value="/employees/raise/{raise:.+}", produces="application/json") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> estimateRaise​(@PathVariable double raise)
      Estimates how much each employee's salary would be if all were given the raise sent in the parameter
      Example: http://localhost:2019/employees/raise/0.05
      Parameters:
      raise - the percentage amount of raise to estimate. Will be a real number. Special code must in place for a route to work with a real number. The parameter must be able to read in a decimal. By default it cannot. So :.+ is added to the end of the parameter in the GetMapping annotation!
      Returns:
      A JSON list of all employees with their estimate salaries based on the given raise percentage.
